list.name: Changes
list.comment:
``` Move Gradle dependency versions to version catalog
This commit moves the versions of several dependencies to the version catalog, centralizing their management and improving build script readability.
The following changes were made: * Removed version definitions from `build.gradle.kts` and `oracle-drive-integration/build.gradle.kts` for plugins and libraries that are now managed by the version catalog. * Added corresponding entries to `gradle/libs.versions.toml` to define these versions centrally. * Updated `build.gradle.kts` to reference these versions from the catalog using the `alias` syntax. * Explicitly applied the Hilt plugin in `oracle-drive-integration/build.gradle.kts` as it's no longer automatically applied via the `build.gradle.kts` in the root project.
```

task.summary:
Refactor: Modernize Gradle build configuration
This commit modernizes the Gradle build configuration by:
- **Introducing a `libs.versions.toml` file:** - Centralizes dependency versions and plugin definitions for better management and consistency. - Replaces previous alias-based plugin applications with direct ID usage where appropriate. - **Updating `build.gradle.kts` (root):** - Simplifies plugin application by removing redundant plugin declarations. - Refines Java toolchain configuration, setting Java 24 for most projects and Java 22 for `buildSrc`. - Removes unnecessary Java home overrides and explicit Java version settings for tasks, relying on the toolchain. - Removes a redundant `com.android.application` plugin configuration block. - Adds `google()` and `mavenCentral()` to project repositories. - **Updating `app/build.gradle.kts`:** - Replaces alias-based plugin applications with direct ID usage. - Updates OpenAPI generator configuration to use `layout` properties for paths. - Ensures OpenAPI generation happens before `preBuild` instead of `compileKotlin`. - Simplifies Kotlin compiler options by moving them to a `tasks.withType<KotlinCompile>()` block. - Removes `vendor = JvmVendorSpec.AZUL` from Java toolchain configuration. - **Updating `collab-canvas/build.gradle.kts`:** - Removes alias-based plugin applications. - **Updating `settings.gradle.kts`:** - Adds `gradlePluginPortal()` to repositories. - Removes `repositoriesMode.set(RepositoriesMode.FAIL_ON_PROJECT_REPOS)` to allow project-level repositories if needed. - **Updating `buildSrc/build.gradle.kts`:** - Updates AGP version to 8.11.1. - Removes explicit repository declarations as they are now in the root `settings.gradle.kts`. - Rebuilds `buildSrc` due to configuration changes.

Refactor: Update Gradle configuration and dependencies
This commit introduces several changes to the Gradle build configuration and dependencies:
**Build Configuration:** - Standardized Java version to 17 across all modules, including `buildSrc`. - Updated Kotlin API and language versions to 2.2.0. - Added common repositories (Google, Maven Central, JetBrains Compose/Kotlin specific). - Refined `build.gradle.kts` for common project settings and plugin application. - Removed outdated or redundant plugin applications. - Updated clean task to use `rootProject.layout.buildDirectory`.
**`app` Module:** - Updated Xposed Framework dependency to use local JARs. - Added `colorblendr` module as a project dependency. - Aligned Compose Bill of Materials (BOM) version. - Ensured Java compilation tasks target Java 17. - Removed redundant Kotlin compile options block.
**`oracle-drive-integration` Module:** - Migrated plugin declarations from `alias` to `id`. - Removed `targetSdk` from `defaultConfig`. - Updated dependency declarations to use specific versions from `libs.versions.toml`.
**`collab-canvas` Module:** - Removed entire previous build script content, leaving only a `repositories` block. This suggests a significant refactor or move of this module's build logic.
**`gradle/libs.versions.toml`:** - Added `xposedbridge` version.
**`settings.gradle.kts`:** - Added new modules: `:sandbox-ui`, `:oracle-drive-integration`, `:colorblendr`.
**Build Outputs:** - Removed various temporary build files (MANIFEST.MF, source-roots.txt) and compiled JARs from `buildSrc`, `collab-canvas`, and `jvm-test`. This is a common practice when build configurations change significantly. - Updated `buildSrc` Gradle cache files.

Refactor: Migrate `sandbox-ui` build script and update dependencies
This commit introduces the following changes:
**`sandbox-ui` Module:** - Migrated the build configuration from `sandbox-ui.gradle.kts` to `build.gradle.kts`. - Applied Android library, Kotlin Android, Kotlin Compose, KSP, and Hilt plugins using type-safe accessors (`alias(libs.plugins...)`). - Configured Android settings: - `namespace`, `compileSdk`, `minSdk`. - `testInstrumentationRunner`, `consumerProguardFiles`. - Release build type with ProGuard configuration. - Java 24 compatibility for source and target. - Enabled Compose and `buildConfig` features. - Set Kotlin compiler extension version for Compose from version catalog. - Added dependencies: - Core project: `api(project(":app"))` - AndroidX: `core-ktx`, `lifecycle-runtime-ktx`, `activity-compose`. - Compose: BOM, UI, tooling preview, Material 3, animation, foundation. - Navigation: `navigation-compose`. - Hilt: Android, compiler (KSP), navigation Compose. - Debug tools: Compose UI tooling and test manifest. - Testing: JUnit, AndroidX Test ext JUnit, Espresso core, Compose UI test JUnit4.
**`oracle-drive-integration` Module:** - Updated dependency declarations to explicitly use versions from the `libs.versions.toml` file instead of type-safe accessors. This applies to: - AndroidX Core (`core-ktx`, `lifecycle-runtime-ktx`) - Compose (`compose-bom`, `ui`, `ui-graphics`, `ui-tooling-preview`, `material3`) - Hilt (`hilt-android`, `hilt-compiler`) - Coroutines (`kotlinx-coroutines-android`) - Testing (`junit`, `androidx.test.ext`, `androidx.test.espresso`) - Imported `com.android.build.gradle.LibraryExtension`.

Refactor: Migrate `sandbox-ui` build script and update dependencies
This commit introduces the following changes:
**`sandbox-ui` Module:** - Migrated the build configuration from `sandbox-ui.gradle.kts` to `build.gradle.kts`. - Applied Android library, Kotlin Android, Kotlin Compose, KSP, and Hilt plugins using type-safe accessors (`alias(libs.plugins...)`). - Configured Android settings: - `namespace`, `compileSdk`, `minSdk`. - `testInstrumentationRunner`, `consumerProguardFiles`. - Release build type with ProGuard configuration. - Java 24 compatibility for source and target. - Enabled Compose and `buildConfig` features. - Set Kotlin compiler extension version for Compose from version catalog. - Added dependencies: - Core project: `api(project(":app"))` - AndroidX: `core-ktx`, `lifecycle-runtime-ktx`, `activity-compose`. - Compose: BOM, UI, tooling preview, Material 3, animation, foundation. - Navigation: `navigation-compose`. - Hilt: Android, compiler (KSP), navigation Compose. - Debug tools: Compose UI tooling and test manifest. - Testing: JUnit, AndroidX Test ext JUnit, Espresso core, Compose UI test JUnit4.
**`oracle-drive-integration` Module:** - Updated dependency declarations to explicitly use versions from the `libs.versions.toml` file instead of type-safe accessors. This applies to: - AndroidX Core (`core-ktx`, `lifecycle-runtime-ktx`) - Compose (`compose-bom`, `ui`, `ui-graphics`, `ui-tooling-preview`, `material3`) - Hilt (`hilt-android`, `hilt-compiler`) - Coroutines (`kotlinx-coroutines-android`) - Testing (`junit`, `androidx.test.ext`, `androidx.test.espresso`) - Imported `com.android.build.gradle.LibraryExtension`.

Refactor: Standardize plugin application in `oracle-drive-integration`
Updated the `oracle-drive-integration/build.gradle.kts` file to apply plugins using their IDs directly in the `plugins {}` block. The plugin versions are managed in the root `build.gradle.kts` file.
This change aligns with common Gradle practices for plugin application and improves clarity.
Additionally, `buildSrc/build/libs/AuraFrameFXBuildSrc.jar` was rebuilt due to the Gradle configuration changes.

Refactor: Update plugin application in `oracle-drive-integration`
This commit updates the `oracle-drive-integration/build.gradle.kts` file to use direct plugin IDs (`id("com.android.library")` and `id("org.jetbrains.kotlin.android")`) instead of aliases for applying the Android library and Kotlin Android plugins.
The `buildSrc` JAR has also been updated, likely as a result of build configuration changes.

Refactor: Update plugin application in `oracle-drive-integration`
This commit updates the `oracle-drive-integration/build.gradle.kts` file to use direct plugin IDs (`id("com.android.library")` and `id("org.jetbrains.kotlin.android")`) instead of aliases for applying the Android library and Kotlin Android plugins.
The `buildSrc` JAR has also been updated, likely as a result of build configuration changes.

Refactor: Update plugin application in `oracle-drive-integration`
This commit updates the `oracle-drive-integration/build.gradle.kts` file to use direct plugin IDs (`id("com.android.library")` and `id("org.jetbrains.kotlin.android")`) instead of aliases for applying the Android library and Kotlin Android plugins.
The `buildSrc` JAR has also been updated, likely as a result of build configuration changes.

MESSAGE.value:
Refactor: Modernize Gradle build configuration
This commit modernizes the Gradle build configuration by:
- **Introducing a `libs.versions.toml` file:** - Centralizes dependency versions and plugin definitions for better management and consistency. - Replaces previous alias-based plugin applications with direct ID usage where appropriate. - **Updating `build.gradle.kts` (root):** - Simplifies plugin application by removing redundant plugin declarations. - Refines Java toolchain configuration, setting Java 24 for most projects and Java 22 for `buildSrc`. - Removes unnecessary Java home overrides and explicit Java version settings for tasks, relying on the toolchain. - Removes a redundant `com.android.application` plugin configuration block. - Adds `google()` and `mavenCentral()` to project repositories. - **Updating `app/build.gradle.kts`:** - Replaces alias-based plugin applications with direct ID usage. - Updates OpenAPI generator configuration to use `layout` properties for paths. - Ensures OpenAPI generation happens before `preBuild` instead of `compileKotlin`. - Simplifies Kotlin compiler options by moving them to a `tasks.withType<KotlinCompile>()` block. - Removes `vendor = JvmVendorSpec.AZUL` from Java toolchain configuration. - **Updating `collab-canvas/build.gradle.kts`:** - Removes alias-based plugin applications. - **Updating `settings.gradle.kts`:** - Adds `gradlePluginPortal()` to repositories. - Removes `repositoriesMode.set(RepositoriesMode.FAIL_ON_PROJECT_REPOS)` to allow project-level repositories if needed. - **Updating `buildSrc/build.gradle.kts`:** - Updates AGP version to 8.11.1. - Removes explicit repository declarations as they are now in the root `settings.gradle.kts`. - Rebuilds `buildSrc` due to configuration changes.

Refactor: Standardize build configuration and update dependencies
This commit introduces several changes to standardize the build configuration and update dependencies across the project.
Key changes include: - Standardized Java and Kotlin versions to 17 and 2.2.0 respectively for all subprojects. - Updated Android Gradle Plugin to 8.11.1. - Refactored `build.gradle.kts` and `app/build.gradle.kts` for clarity and consistency. - Simplified plugin application in `oracle-drive-integration/build.gradle.kts`. - Updated various dependencies to their latest stable versions, including Compose, Hilt, and testing libraries. - Added Xposed Framework API as a dependency. - Included new modules: `sandbox-ui`, `oracle-drive-integration`, and `colorblendr` in `settings.gradle.kts`. - Removed obsolete build files and configurations, including manifest files and source roots for `buildSrc`. - Simplified the `collab-canvas/build.gradle.kts` to a minimal configuration.
These changes aim to improve build times, maintainability, and ensure compatibility with the latest Android development practices.

Refactor: Update Gradle configuration and dependencies
This commit introduces several changes to the Gradle build configuration and dependencies:
**Build Configuration:** - Standardized Java version to 17 across all modules, including `buildSrc`. - Updated Kotlin API and language versions to 2.2.0. - Added common repositories (Google, Maven Central, JetBrains Compose/Kotlin specific). - Refined `build.gradle.kts` for common project settings and plugin application. - Removed outdated or redundant plugin applications. - Updated clean task to use `rootProject.layout.buildDirectory`.
**`app` Module:** - Updated Xposed Framework dependency to use local JARs. - Added `colorblendr` module as a project dependency. - Aligned Compose Bill of Materials (BOM) version. - Ensured Java compilation tasks target Java 17. - Removed redundant Kotlin compile options block.
**`oracle-drive-integration` Module:** - Migrated plugin declarations from `alias` to `id`. - Removed `targetSdk` from `defaultConfig`. - Updated dependency declarations to use specific versions from `libs.versions.toml`.
**`collab-canvas` Module:** - Removed entire previous build script content, leaving only a `repositories` block. This suggests a significant refactor or move of this module's build logic.
**`gradle/libs.versions.toml`:** - Added `xposedbridge` version.
**`settings.gradle.kts`:** - Added new modules: `:sandbox-ui`, `:oracle-drive-integration`, `:colorblendr`.
**Build Outputs:** - Removed various temporary build files (MANIFEST.MF, source-roots.txt) and compiled JARs from `buildSrc`, `collab-canvas`, and `jvm-test`. This is a common practice when build configurations change significantly. - Updated `buildSrc` Gradle cache files.

Refactor: Migrate `sandbox-ui` build script and update dependencies
This commit introduces the following changes:
**`sandbox-ui` Module:** - Migrated the build configuration from `sandbox-ui.gradle.kts` to `build.gradle.kts`. - Applied Android library, Kotlin Android, Kotlin Compose, KSP, and Hilt plugins using type-safe accessors (`alias(libs.plugins...)`). - Configured Android settings: - `namespace`, `compileSdk`, `minSdk`. - `testInstrumentationRunner`, `consumerProguardFiles`. - Release build type with ProGuard configuration. - Java 24 compatibility for source and target. - Enabled Compose and `buildConfig` features. - Set Kotlin compiler extension version for Compose from version catalog. - Added dependencies: - Core project: `api(project(":app"))` - AndroidX: `core-ktx`, `lifecycle-runtime-ktx`, `activity-compose`. - Compose: BOM, UI, tooling preview, Material 3, animation, foundation. - Navigation: `navigation-compose`. - Hilt: Android, compiler (KSP), navigation Compose. - Debug tools: Compose UI tooling and test manifest. - Testing: JUnit, AndroidX Test ext JUnit, Espresso core, Compose UI test JUnit4.
**`oracle-drive-integration` Module:** - Updated dependency declarations to explicitly use versions from the `libs.versions.toml` file instead of type-safe accessors. This applies to: - AndroidX Core (`core-ktx`, `lifecycle-runtime-ktx`) - Compose (`compose-bom`, `ui`, `ui-graphics`, `ui-tooling-preview`, `material3`) - Hilt (`hilt-android`, `hilt-compiler`) - Coroutines (`kotlinx-coroutines-android`) - Testing (`junit`, `androidx.test.ext`, `androidx.test.espresso`) - Imported `com.android.build.gradle.LibraryExtension`.

Refactor: Update plugin application in `oracle-drive-integration`
This commit updates the `oracle-drive-integration/build.gradle.kts` file to use direct plugin IDs (`id("com.android.library")` and `id("org.jetbrains.kotlin.android")`) instead of aliases for applying the Android library and Kotlin Android plugins.
The `buildSrc` JAR has also been updated, likely as a result of build configuration changes.

option.value:
Refactor: Update plugin application in `oracle-drive-integration`
This commit updates the `oracle-drive-integration/build.gradle.kts` file to use direct plugin IDs (`id("com.android.library")` and `id("org.jetbrains.kotlin.android")`) instead of aliases for applying the Android library and Kotlin Android plugins.
The `buildSrc` JAR has also been updated, likely as a result of build configuration changes.
